review_title: Not world-class, too much micromanagement, too much top-down, absurd amount of red tape
pros: There are plenty of opportunities to secure research funding in Singapore.
cons:
The quality of the research is varying. Some faculty members are clearly not up to the mark. Certain departments may do well on international rankings, however, the university is investing much time and effort in boosting the ranking, instead of investing effort in improving the conditions for their employees and students.
Senior management imposes many constraints, whereas the departments micromanage their faculty members and staff. Approvals need to be requested for any minor decision. Professors cannot decide much on their own, which is very frustrating.
There is an incredible amount of red tape, which is time-consuming and slows down your research. Most admin people are also incompetent and unable to answer most questions.
The IT systems are quite sloppy and outdated. Employees need to use numerous different systems that are not compatible with each other.

review_title: Put Up and Shut Up: Hierarchy and Isolation
pros: The salary is well above assistant Professor level in the USA. The location of South East Asia leaves many interesting cultures very accessible. It's a good place for older professors to come as a visiting professor to pad their retirement. It is not good for a person trying to begin as Assistant Professor and expect promotion. There are a few lucky ones but there is no Rhyme or Reason as to who gets promoted. It is not due to the work achieved. No one knows what the standards are everything is kept unknown.
cons: The management is top down only. Even the Chair and Dean can do nothing. They only take orders from the Provost and President who are completely detached and have no idea what the specific school is about. At the faculty meetings a member of faculty is to say nothing, if they do they could get a letter from the chair telling them never to talk at a meeting again. But why bother speaking at a meeting? The faculty are only there to go through the actions, because they are to listen and follow through on new procedures only. They have no input. The university is extremely compartmentalized. The management does not have to give you a reason for anything. There is no mentorship of any kind. Professors go to their office and then to the classroom and goes home there is no social communication between professors. Singapore is artificial and very expensive. A glass of wine is 20-25 dollars. If your favorite places are "lovely Hotels" then is may be the city for you! The culture is hierarchal. They may go through the motions to have a "networking  luncheon" between schools and when you arrive there is a buffet and a VIP buffet!

review_title: both good and bad in the same basket...
pros: Pay is above the market rate. Benefits are good. The working environment can be relaxed especially during the school holidays.
cons:
The work you do depends on the supervisor you work with. You may work hard and learn; or rot at one corner...

The professors may not really know their 'art' but can jolly well put their names on the scientific papers written by their students and take credit for the work they merely contribute...
